page.title: 07FARMING IN FRILSHAM (1)
page.content: There are 7 farms in these 12 sqKms. They are all both{arable and dairy.} They are neat and well cared for and the buildings are sound.{Cereals}grown are{wheat and barley. Cows}are mostly {Fresians}which have a high milk yield. We saw no{sheep. Pigs}are kept in the open sheltered in small huts.{Hens}are kept in battery houses. One farm has 2000 looked after by one man. Most fields are{under 30 acres.}Stubble is rarely burned as it is used for the livestock and hedges are retained. Workers still live on or near the farm but their numbers have decreased sharply with the use of modern machinery. Ploughing, sowing, reaping and fertilising are all{mechanised. Horses are little used for work. Farm workers have a good standard of living and have excellent relationships with farmers who look after them well.
